criteria: Identification of situations requiring Standard Precautions
descriptions: Does not identify any situations where Standard Precautions are necessary.
Identifies one situation inappropriately or vaguely.
Identifies one situation where Standard Precautions are appropriate, but lacks detail.
Identifies two situations where Standard Precautions are appropriate and provides some detail.
Identifies three situations where Standard Precautions are appropriate, providing clear and relevant details for each.
Identifies multiple situations (more than 3) where Standard Precautions are appropriate, clearly describing each situation and why the precautions are necessary.
Demonstrates no understanding of Standard Precautions.
Misidentifies or inaccurately describes Standard Precautions.
Identifies some elements of Standard Precautions but with significant inaccuracies or omissions.
Describes Standard Precautions with minor inaccuracies or omissions.
Accurately describes most components of Standard Precautions, such as hand hygiene, PPE usage, and safe injection practices.
Comprehensively and accurately describes all key components of Standard Precautions, demonstrating a thorough understanding.
Provides no justification for using Standard Precautions in any situation.
Offers a vague or irrelevant justification for using Standard Precautions.
Provides a basic justification for using Standard Precautions in at least one situation.
Explains why Standard Precautions are needed in some situations, linking it to infection control.
Clearly justifies the use of Standard Precautions in multiple situations, explaining the rationale behind each precaution.
Provides comprehensive and insightful justifications for using Standard Precautions, explaining the underlying principles of infection control and prevention in various scenarios.
